text: [Applause]
hi everyone rosetonygoldtano here the
internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of the new
blade album
the fool this is the latest full-length
lp from sweden's own
blade rapper singer producer whose work
i've had a hard time digesting in the
past
most specifically his 2018 lp red light
which i still have my issues with to
this day between
all the weak vocal performances abusive
levels of auto-tune
some questionable mixing on these very
synth heavy instrumentals backed with
trap beats
in one breath i appreciated how
futuristic all of it sounded but then
in another the execution side of things
still left a lot to be desired
however blade has continued to hone his
drained aesthetic
since then surprising even me with some
surreal abstract production on his 333
project last year
and i had assumed he might dig further
into that sound down the road on future
releases
but after a hyper pop-leaning
collaboration with mecha talk
blade brings us the fool which is
possibly his most accessible not
experimental project
yet the beats on this thing are pretty
cut and dry very melodic
harmonious well-balanced blissful and
clear
much of the time the songs on this
project are structured pretty neatly as
well
but as far as the vocals go blade at
this point is still not the most
charismatic singer in the world for me
on this project it's also about what
he's not
doing here he's not singing too much out
of his range he's not straining too much
he is not driving the auto-tune into the
ground
and through much of the fool lyrically i
found consistent themes of
spirituality theism living free and
through the process of painting this
picture
i think blade gives fans a crystal clear
image of his personality from the dreamy
allusions to love
and existentialism on i think to the
non-stop playful humor throughout the
verses on hotel breakfast
there's really a cleanliness a sweetness
and a heavenly quality
to this project that i think could make
it translate even for blade skeptics
because even i'm finding more of an
appeal in this than i thought
cause while i'm still not crazy about
the vocals there
is a weirdly quirky boyish and alien
quality to them that i like
that and the content of his verses along
with
how euphoric the production is is enough
to win me over on key tracks
like on the hypnotic let's ride from the
pulsating and reverb
synths to the low-key flows blade has
crafted a mesmerizing banger on this one
lyrically we see him diving into themes
of living free
doing what you want for fun just kind of
leading your own life
also flirting with religion interning
with the faith but i just got hired
in a weird way i feel like i'm listening
to all of these
innocent pleasure-seeking bars laced
into some friendly theistic raps
then there's the funny hotel breakfast i
mentioned earlier which features a lot
of bouncy synth passages bars like a pop
out like a toast your late breakfast
closed
this among many other bars on the track
are a little tongue-in-cheek
especially the one where he's talking
about what being a good boy on the track
no cussing
this one's just fun kind of carefree and
certainly shows blade
bringing a high level of self-awareness
to what he does
on baby i love that thumping bass and
just that edm style synth lead burning
through the mix
easily one of the brightest cuts on the
fool which is only enhanced by its
its chorus believe me when those
falsetto vocals like
layer up in this sopping wet mix it's
really blissful and to a degree
otherworldly even if the elements going
into it between
the beat and the chimey synths and the
singing
seem pretty obvious separately there's
also the track
trendy which in my opinion is the most
passionate on the vocal side of the
entire record
typically on his vocal performances he
tends to turn the emotion down a little
bit
deliver in a somewhat emotionally
monotone way but that's just not the
case for this track between that and how
blaring some of the synths are here this
one is
kind of turned up as as far as you know
drain gang music goes
now i will say despite all of these
compliments and there being highlights
on this record that i liked
there were points where the vocals did
fall short of where i would have liked
them to be
like on search true i mean despite all
of the auto-tune
blade still fails to muster up some
decent harmonious vocal layering here
which does hinder this track's full
bliss potential
i feel somewhat the same way about the
track desiree too some of the vocal
overdubs on the nine is
up come off a little awkward as well
then there are maybe a few cuts where
structurally i was wanting a little bit
more like on ego baby where
at one point we get this great falsetto
rush of
vocals really bright engaging passage
but then after this point the song just
kind of fizzles out into nothing
so while there are a lot of strong
choruses and well-structured tracks
on this album for sure uh not every cut
here seems to get that same treatment
and for me there's also the matter of
the production on this one which isn't
necessarily bad or anything
but man do a lot of the trap perks on
this one sound very
plain and very kind of dime-a-dozen like
as clean
and as direct and as sweet as this
record is which again i think is to its
credit
the result of that in this instance i
think has been his
safest release today there's not really
a whole lot of experimentation or
adventure going on here
for sure it's a pleasant listen but it
doesn't necessarily expand
the universe of that drained sound nor
does it sound like it's on the cusp of
anything
in the way that 333 did still much of
the time on this project i think blade
makes up for all of that stuff
in a variety of different ways be it
through his song writing his lyrical
themes his
charming boyish lead vocals and yeah
while i didn't love this
i did kind of enjoy it certainly enjoyed
it more than a lot of what i've heard
from blade in the past
and that's why i can say i'm feeling a
strong six on this one
tran position have you given this album
a listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well
over here next to my head is another
video for you to check out hit that up
or the link to subscribe to the channel
anthonyfantano ablade forever
